poem:
**Counting the Cost**

Pounds fall like autumn leaves,  
clipped from branches of hope.  
In cold council chambers,  
cash registers echo—  
an abacus of lives  
left wanting.  
  
Empty wallets grow heavy,  
weighted with whispers:  
Invisible burdens  
that no ledger can tally,  
no budget can bear.  
Amidst the cuts,  
who will stitch the seams?
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Last week, work and pensions secretary Liz Kendall published a green paper including a package of cuts to disability benefits. Up to 1.2 million fewer people could be eligible for Pip by 2029/30". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
